required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Measuring the Peripheral Optical Quality of The Eye
clinical_study.official_title: Measuring the Peripheral Optical Quality of The Eye

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the study is to quantify wavefront aberration profiles of the eye with and without contact lens across the visual field. This will enable us to investigate the impact of the aberration on retinal image quality.

detailed_description.textblock: The goal of this study is to investigate the effects of monofocal and bifocal soft contact lenses in the changes of peripheral optical quality and through-focus visual performance on real eyes. The goal will be accomplished by performing optical measurements using Shack-Hartmann wavefront sensor with and without the use of single vision and bifocal soft contact lenses.

primary_outcome.description: The scanning wavefront sensor will be used to collect data. Mean Wavefront aberrations for each trail will be analyzed.

arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo three Wavefront measurements, once with no contact lens, once with a monofocal contact lens and once with a bifocal contact lens.

intervention.description: A monofocal contact lens will be used for this measurement.
A bifocal contact lens will be used for this measurement.
